title: Feature request: Vaultwarden integration (like Thycotic Secret Server)
author: sascha-schwegelbauer
body_snippet: It would be great if mRemoteNG has an integration with an on-prem vaultwarden-instance.

comments.snippet:
If implemented I guess this would cover Bitwarden as well, which would be nice. 

Anyhow, there are currently two other rivaling "issues", namely #187 (KeePass) and #2212 (1Password). I guess in the end the implementation depends on the resources the developer has or if there is anybody implementing it.
comments.author: simonai1254

comments.snippet:
Not sure if the current implementation could differentiate between multiple secret providers (I did not really dig deep, maybe a project-dev could write a few lines for clarity)
(https://github.com/mRemoteNG/mRemoteNG/blob/c94eac3863ed89cf53a47f1359fa80cea6044daa/ExternalConnectors/DSS/SecretServerInterface.cs#LL150C34-L150C34)
comments.author: sascha-schwegelbauer

comments.snippet: hello, where is a plan to implement profiles, then it will be posible to set what provider should be used to fetch credentials as per connection entity or per group. Group could be taged and dont nessesary be in same folder. I beleave that will give enoght flexibility to end users. One more thing what i would like to implement is a extensions or plugins, so any developer may make an addon to extend providers to any flavour :) but need a bit work on implementation, but that I am moving forwards t...
comments.author: Kvarkas

comments.snippet:
A Plugin-Framework is always nice (but labor intensive)
For the first throw, IMO it would be sufficient when a single credential provider can be picked from a list.
(I think most users do not use more than one password manager)
comments.author: sascha-schwegelbauer

comments.snippet:
Hello, the implementation for secret server was in done in a way that multiple different providers can easily be implemented, there is a dropdown selector called "external credential provider". this selection is then honored in the calling code in ssh/rdp connections. not a picture perfect solution, but it works.

![image](https://github.com/mRemoteNG/mRemoteNG/assets/4305825/3bc78cbf-5a89-487b-a249-f82b9e913f49)

i agree that a plugin based system would be nice, but who has time for this?
comments.author: tecxx

comments.snippet: I should deliver another project in next 2 weeks then should be much more free so will be focusing on such as well
